intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium macrogrovesianum subsp. colfioritense, commonly known as the Colfiorito hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is known for its small, hairy leaves and its ability to thrive in harsh, cold environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
